caseName: Schiller v. Town Of Ramapo

recap_documents.description: OPINION AND ORDER   re:  217     MOTION  to Dismiss Plaintiffs' Third Amended Complaint filed by Melissa A. Cobuzzi,   M & R Energy Resource Corp.,  231     MOTION  to Dismiss Plaintiffs' Third Amended Complaint  filed by Step hen  Wemple,   Consolidated Edison Solutions, Inc., Patrick  O'Gara,  221     MOTION  to Dismiss By The Constellation Defendants To Dismiss Plaintiffs Third Amended Complaint filed by Jody  Spaeth, Jeffrey S. Hills,   Constellation NewEne rgy, Inc.,  216     MOTION  to Dismiss  filed by   Municipal Electric and Gas Alliance, Incorporated,  228     MOTION  to Dismiss Third Amended Complaint filed by   EnergyNext, Inc. For the reasons stated above, the motions to dismiss o f Defendants Duthie, (Doc. 201), MEGA, (Doc. 216), Cobuzzi and M&R, (Doc. 217), Hills, Spaeth, and Constellation,  (Doc. 221), Boyd and EnergyNext, (Doc. 228), and O'Gara, Wemple, and ConEd, (Doc. 231), are GRANTED. Counts One, Five, Six, Seven  and Eight are dismissed with prejudice, and Counts Three, Four and Nine are dismissed without prejudice.  The Clerk of Court is directed to amend the caption as set forth in footnote  one, terminate the pending motions, (Docs. 201, 216, 217, 221, 228, 231), and close the case.    (Signed by Judge Cathy Seibel on 8/28/2017)  (mml)

recap_documents.description: OPINION AND ORDER re: 507 MOTION to Dismiss Second Consolidated Amended Class Action Complaint. filed by Bank of Tokyo-Mitsubishi UFJ Ltd., Standard Chartered PLC, Morgan Stanley, RBC Capital Markets, LLC, Societe Generale S.A., Morgan Stanley & Co. LLC, Credit Suisse AG, Credit Suisse Securities (USA) LLC, Morgan Stanley & Co. International plc, Deutsche Bank AG, Credit Suisse Group AG. For the foregoing reasons, the NSDs' motion is GRANTED with respect to - Plaintiffs' antitrust claims based on transactions executed on foreign exchanges; - Plaintiffs' antitrust claims based on transactions between U.S.-domiciled OTC Plaintiffs (operating outside the United States) and a foreign desk of a Defendant; - Plaintiffs' claims (antitrust and CEA) based on transactions executed before December 1, 2007; - Exchange Plaintiffs' CEA false reporting claims; and - Exchange Plaintiffs' CEA claims arising out of transactions conducted on foreign exchanges. The motion is DENIED as to all other claims. The Clerk of Court is directed to close the motion at Docket No. 507. (Signed by Judge Lorna G. Schofield on 9/20/2016) (kgo) (Entered: 09/20/2016)
